hypothesis_content.title: ETF Flow Reversal After Extreme Outflow Days
hypothesis_content.statement: When US Bitcoin ETFs experience a net outflow exceeding $300M in a single day (like recent $600M liquidation event), the following 3 trading days will see a mean-reverting inflow averaging >$150M total, driving BTC price recovery of 3-8% from the outflow day's low.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extreme ETF outflows often represent forced selling or panic. Institutional rebalancing and contrarian buyers typically step in within days, creating a technical bounce. The $600M liquidation event provides a recent stress test case.
entry_conditions: US Spot Bitcoin ETF net outflow >$300M in one day
BTC price closes below opening price on outflow day
ETF flow data is confirmed (next morning 9:30 AM ET)
BTC is not in STRESS regime (VIX < 25)
hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Outflows >$300M are followed by continued outflows or neutral flows (<$50M net) for 3 consecutive days, with price failing to recover >50% of the outflow day's decline.
